course_title: Freshman Seminar:Biology: Science of our Social Brains
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 16 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This seminar will explore the neurobiological basis for a wide range of our social behaviors by learning from scientific research conducted in animals and humans.  We will discuss how love begins, why it is possible to fall in love with the `wrong person, how mirror neurons help us understand the actions of others, and how does the brain's ability to change with experience impact our social biases.
sections: Class Nbr: 1673, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: Liu/Lu, Status: Wait List
